result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy A West was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction - the first 21 days are straight time - the balance can be served with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program - no objecdtion to electronic monitoring while in the program - and 3 days credit.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes:
SERVE 60 DAYS at the House of Correction commencing 11-10-15 with work release for actual employment - no good time. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

16A 000268
Had money moved and re-applied including $50 in bond that was never ordered forfeited but was not applied when case was first closed. gj

Defendant Stacy A West in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction - the first 21 days are straight time - the balance can be served with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program - no objecdtion to electronic monitoring while in the program - and 3 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, DNA surcharges, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) SERVE 60 DAYS at the House of Correction commencing 11-10-15 with work release for actual employment - no good time. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.
Justice Point report dated 11-2-15 received and filed./ds
Character Letter from Defendant's Fiance' received and filed

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.

Defendant Stacy A West in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

DUPLICATE FILE IN COURT.   Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court accepts the Amended Information and AMENDS the charge to Possession of THC (tetrahydrocannabinols) - 2nd and subsequent offense 961.41(3g)(e) a Class I felony.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Original transcript of Preliminary Hearing on 9-4-15, received and filed.  (18 Pages)./ds
Justice Point report dated 10-19-15 received and filed./ds
State's Response to Motion to Suppress received and filed.
Suppression Motions iwth Memorandum received and filed./ds

Defendant has $150 posted.  Court ordered $50.00 cash be forfeited.  Court ordered that bail remain set at $150.00 cash (defendant would need to post $50.00), all other terms and conditions of bail remain the same.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.

Defendant Stacy A West in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address Justice Point violation. Justice Point violation report received and filed (positive drug test).  Arguments heard as to bail. 

Case remains scheduled for motion hearing on 10/20/15 at 1:30pm in Branch 44.

Defendant Stacy A West in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Schubert has received discovery and CD's today.  Defense asks for a motion hearing.  Court states any and all motions will be heard at the next date.  Motions to be filed on 10-1-15; response/reply to be filed by 10-08-15.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Stacy A West in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Paul Hauer for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of all State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:William Savagian-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 9/3/15.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
